info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Angel Fire, or 24 miles east of Taos. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Angel Fire and Black Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 near Mile Marker 289. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 25 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
